metadata.title: CVE-2015-2313 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Sandstorm Cap'n Proto before 0.4.1.1 and 0.5.x before 0.5.1.2, when anapplication invokes the totalSize method on an object reader, allows remotepeers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption) via a crafted smallmessage, which triggers a "tight" for loop.  NOTE: this vulnerabilityexists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2015-2312.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-2313` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

capnproto - 0.4.0-1ubuntu2.1
libcapnp-0.4.0 - 0.4.0-1ubuntu2.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: capnproto package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.4.0-1ubuntu2.1').
